normalised: fiber to home expansion gathers momentum across India

unnormalised: New Delhi – Telecom operators are aggressively expanding Fiber-to-Home (FTTH) infrastructure across India, spurred by rising demand for high-speed internet. Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are leading the charge, laying thousands of kilometers of optical fiber cable.
normalised: New Delhi – telecom operators are aggressively expanding fiber to home (F T T H) infrastructure across India, spurred by rising demand for high speed internet. Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are leading the charge, laying thousands of kilometers of optical fiber cable.

unnormalised: Dr. Rajesh Kumar, a telecom analyst at IIT-Bombay, noted, "The pandemic accelerated digital adoption, making robust broadband connectivity essential. FTTH is crucial for supporting online education, work-from-home, and streaming services."
normalised: doctor Rajesh Kumar, a telecom analyst at I I T-Bombay, noted, "the pandemic accelerated digital adoption, making robust broadband connectivity essential. F T T H is crucial for supporting online education, work from home, and streaming services."

unnormalised: Recent reports indicate that the government's BharatNet project is also playing a significant role, connecting rural areas to the digital highway. Tata Communications has secured a major contract to enhance FTTH infrastructure in the North-East region.
normalised: Recent reports indicate that the government's BharatNet project is also playing a significant role, connecting rural areas to the digital highway. Tata Communications has secured a major contract to enhance F T T H infrastructure in the North-East region.

unnormalised: Analysts estimate that FTTH subscriptions have grown by over 40% in the last year. The average monthly data consumption per user is also on the rise. Some reports suggest rates as low as Rs. 499 per month for basic plans.
normalised: Analysts estimate that F T T H subscriptions have grown by over forty percent in the last year. The average monthly data consumption per user is also on the rise. Some reports suggest rates as low as rupee four hundred and ninety nine per month for basic plans.

unnormalised: Airtel recently announced a new initiative to provide FTTH connectivity to over 5,000 homes in the bustling locality of Bandra, Mumbai. Their premium plan promises speeds up to 1 Gbps. New players are also offering bundled deals including OTT subscriptions and smart home integrations for apartments upwards of 1500 sq ft.
normalised: Airtel recently announced a new initiative to provide F T T H connectivity to over five thousand homes in the bustling locality of Bandra, Mumbai. Their premium plan promises speeds up to one G B P S. New players are also offering bundled deals including O T T subscriptions and smart home integrations for apartments upwards of one thousand five hundred square feet.
